intro: Lipochaeta kahoolawensis, commonly known as Kahoolawe lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kahoolawe. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat, featuring succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. Lipochaeta kahoolawensis is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native ecosystem.
